wikipedia_page.main: David Sydney Rowe-Beddoe, Baron Rowe-Beddoe,  (born 19 December 1937) is a Welsh businessman, a life peer and a crossbench member of the House of Lords. Lord Rowe-Beddoe is a former chairman of the Welsh Development Agency, and was chairman of Cardiff Airport until November 2016.

* David Rowe-Beddoe, Baron Rowe-Beddoe, British politician and member of the House of Lords
* David Rowe-Beddoe, Baron Rowe-Beddoe (born 1937), British politician
* David Rowe-Beddoe, Baron Rowe-Beddoe, chairman of the Wales Millennium Centre

The Marriage (Wales) Act 2010 c.6 is an Act of Parliament in the United Kingdom. Introduced as a private member's bill by David Rowe-Beddoe, Baron Rowe-Beddoe and sponsored by Alun Michael MP, it received royal assent on 18 March 2010. It created the Church in Wales' counterpart to mirror the Church of England Marriage Measure 2008 No. 1 and brought the Church in Wales' marriage regulations into line with those of the Church of England.
